original_title: Bronx: 1950 West Farms Road - Tremont Avenue (East).
text:
1950 West Farms Road, south of the southeast corner of E. Tremont Avenue, showing the Crowther Mansion, built-1816. It later became part of the bleachery works located here.

Views 1,2

View 3: E. P. Chrystie

about 1915
April 16, 1927

2022 Boston Road, east side, between East Tremont Ave. and East 178th Street.

About 1925.

W. B. Vernam.

Lillian Place, west side, north from Boston Road, to and including East Tremont Ave. The 6-story apartment house at the S.W. corner of East Tremont Ave. bears No. 1006 on the latter. Lillian Place, a 1-block street running north and south from Boston Road to East Tremont Ave., between Boston Road and Bryant Ave., appears on G.W. Bromley's map of 1924 as revised to September 1932, but does not appear on the zoning map of 1937 issued by the Board of Estimate and Apportionment of the City of New York.

July 23, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

1015 and 1017 East Tremont Ave., north side, between Bryant Ave. and Boston Road. No. 1015 is occupied by the Abe Pfeiffer Democratic Club.

P. L. Sperr.
April 4, 1936.
title: Bronx: East Tremont Avenue - No. 1015 to 1017.

text:
1025 East Tremont Ave., at the N.W. corner of Boston Road. This 3-story frame house also bears No. 1995 on the latter thoroughfare. Also shown is a view eastward on East Tremont Ave. and part of the East 177th Street station of the I.R.T. Lexington Ave. subway line.

P. L. Sperr.

April 4, 1936.
title: Bronx: East Tremont Avenue - No. 1025.
